titleInfo.title: Indian graves unearthed, Goodlettsville, Tennessee, 1958 August 28

mods.identifier: Banner 1958-2417 indian graves Goodlettsville Aug25 1958 Goodman 001

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: The discovery of two Indian graves unearthed in Goodlettsville, described in the Aug. 28th, 1958 Nashville Banner: “Beside a Goodlettsville chimney, two Indian graves were unearthed Thursday by excavators on the old William Connell Farm, a mile north of Goodlettsville on old Springfield Road. Outlined with stones, the graves were discovered during remodeling of the 118-year-old Connell house. The landmark will become the home of Mr. and Mrs. J.C. Garrett who recently purchased the house and a number of surrounding acres.” Forms part of Nashville Banner Negatives Collection. 1 photographic negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
